Material used.Description: Cultured SN dopaminergic neurons prepared from PINK1 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1-deficient SN dopaminergic neurons exhibited depolarized ΔΨm, fragmented mitochondria, increased mitochondrial superoxide and ROS generation, and augmented rotenone-induced cell death. Overexpression of wild-type PINK1 restored normal function, while PARK6 mutants (G309D, E417G, CΔ145) failed to rescue these defects.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 overexpression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1-null neurons served as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal mitochondrial function, including polarized ΔΨm and intact mitochondrial morphology.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Depolarized ΔΨm, fragmented mitochondria, increased ROS levels, and augmented cell death.
